intro: Borreria ocymoides f. tenuis, commonly known as the slender borreria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in terminal inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
